title: From Baselines to Breakthroughs: A Month of LLM Experiments
summary: A behind-the-scenes look at failures, ablations, and the two tweaks that mattered most.

blocks.text: A month of experiments taught me that iteration speed beats fancy architecture changes. Here are the notes I wish I had on day one.
The boring fix worked every time.
The most useful baseline was the simplest one with meticulous logging. It saved time when later variants underperformed.

items: Adding task-specific examples to the system prompt.
Normalizing output formats to reduce evaluation noise.
